text: 12/24/[PHONE] 21:12 193 Garbage collectors not doing their job properly The garbage collectors come at their own convenient time.in this area..it can be anywhere from 6 in the morning to 12 noon. And then there are days they don't come at all. They also demand money on the first of every month but refuse if the trash is too much or is like a big box like a washing machine box etc. To add to that they take dry waste on some days and went on the others as per their convenience again. They keep changing the days when they take dry waste which keeps piling in people's home. For 3 continuous days I have been denied collection of dry waste saying it's wet day even on the day when it was supposed to be a dry waste day. Why is it so BBMP? text: 12-6-[PHONE] 14:20 85 Stray dogs, wild long grass and uneven roads Dear Sir/Mam, I have started living in the above mentioned address for a month now and really like the overall connectivity and facilities afforded by the locality. However there are a few things which have been disturbing me and adding to a lot of stress 1. There are stray dogs in almost all the lanes and it feels really scary at any time since they start barking and attacking and I am not their not sure of their vaccinations status 2. There are patches of greenery but it is badly maintained and there are bats and probably other wild animals also due to this. 3. The roads repair work though in progress is being done in only some sections leading to uneven roads bad for walking as well as early damage to vehicles. 4. There is frequent electricity outage while we appreciate the gas pipeline work which is a major reason for the power cuts but a timeline of when we can expect a more stable electricity would also help. 75 10.0 740, 4Th Main Rd, Beml Layout, Brookefield, Bengaluru, Karnataka [PHONE], India Straight from Venkateshwara Temple 12.[PHONE] 77.[PHONE] Dodda Nekkundi 19.0 Animal Husbandry Controlling Of Stray Cattle Or Maintenance Of Cattle Pound BBMP Open 0

text: 2/28/[PHONE] 8:43 197 Irregular collection of wet waste Pourakarmikas are very irregular in collection of wet waste in our area. They don't turn up for weeks together. This results in decomposing of garbage at our houses and resulting in fly nuisance and horrible smells. Pourakarmikas are very prompt during the first week of every month during the collection of money. After which no one even bothers to come. And if they do come, they are very silent without any alerts of any sort like no Whistles or announcements. They also come during odd hours of the day. There is no fixed time for them. All in all, this has become a terrible headache for the residents of 1st main road. text: 4/20/[PHONE] 15:13 81 Outer ring road is swept but the mud/sand etc is not picked up, instead left in mounds, along the roads, medians , on footpaths etc 2 months back, i took a ride from Bellandur to Kalyan Nagar and back( I live in Bangalore ) with the specific intention of taking pictures along the outer ring road to capture the negligence of the authorities who are in charge of cleaning the roads in this stretch. In short here is what you see: 1) Mounds of sand/mud along the sides or medians of the ORR in many stretches including flyovers, maximum after the More flyover when going towards KR Puram station. These mounds are not natural formations, they have been made by someone, quite obvious by the people who have swept the road, perhaps with the intention that it would be picked up by another team , but then that has not happened. These mounds of mud still exist in after a month! 2) You can see the same mounds of mud and sand on the top portion of flyover to Kasturinagar from Tin Factory. The mud and sand are neatly arranged as small mountains( kids might love to see them !! ) on the footpath. Again they exist till date!! 3) The state of underpasses at the center of the underpass right under the bridge on top, should be seen, mainly the Ram Murthy Nagar and Horamavu underpass. You can see lot of sand/mud on the side of the road along with lot of the same accumulated on the footpaths. If a two wheeler goes towards the side of the roads in speed, the rider is sure of getting the "last ride". I can go on and on listing such stuff. The same scenes can be seen on Indiranagar 100 ft road, sarjapur road, old airport road etc. I fail to understand this!! When someone has swept the road, am sure some money would have paid for doing the same, why is the stuff not being picked up!! Instead it is left lying there, in fact you can see plants growing in many of these sand/mud mounds!! Can't Bangalore have cleaner roads, is it that difficult? Many a times citizens add to the mess by throwing garbage on top of these mounds of sand/mud. Please stop doing this!! I have not seen this state in any other city. The idea of taking the pics was that reaches the concerned authorities and they take some action. Now, just uploading the photos( around 50 of them ) would have been very boring. So, i decided to make a video with the photos, along with an inspirational song. It is more than 2 months now but absolutely nothing has been done till now. 155 10.0 Mahadevapura, Bengaluru, Karnataka, India DELL EMC Corporation 12.[PHONE] 77.[PHONE] Vijnana Nagar 6.0 Garbage and Unsanitary Practices Clearance Of Garbage Dump Or Black Spot BBMP Re-opened 12

text: 12-7-[PHONE] 12:57 160 Using residential house to store tons of sanitizer,toilet clear and soap causing health issues Dear Madam / Sir, House no 937 ground floor 3rd stage beml complex 9th cross 12th main has been rented for commercial purpose and dumped with harmful toxic and highly inflammable raw materials and goods used in manufacturing sanitizers,soap and toilet cleaners. It is Causing lot of strong chemical smell and impacting health of the citizens residing in and around the area. There are lot of kids and senior citizens with critical health conditions residing in this area. It is causing lot of health issues such as irritation in nose,difficulty in breathing and throat pain,watering of eyes,itching and breathing difficulties. They also run the motor for packaging for upto 6 hours everyday due to which their is lot of noise pollution. There is lot of vehicles and people coming through out the day. we requested the house owner (who has rented this house to shop) and shop owner to kindly vacate the location as it is highly inflammable(sanitizers) and causing lot of health issue in residential area. But the request has been rejected. We also complained to the BBMP garbage and health inspector. But no action has been taken yet and we have been redirected to contact higher authorities stating this is out of their control. I kindly request you to look into the matter and help the people around this area. This building has been constructed over odd site right next to an open drainage. All the wastes has been dumped into this drainage and it is blocking the water flow during rainy season and resulting in mosquitoes and bad odour. kindly help in closing such open drainage. The owner has been renting this building various youngsters and such shopping tenants which is causing lot of disturbances. 167 7.0 Beml Layout 3Rd Stage, Rr Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka [PHONE], India Beml complex 12.[PHONE] 77.[PHONE] Rajarajeshwari Nagar 11.0 Pollution Pollution - Others KSPCB Open 1

text: 2/23/[PHONE] 23:35 6 Water supply Sir, I have to state that a bore was dug last 6 months back and till date the connection is not given. Further, i have to state that the situation of the roads in this area is so pathetic that we are unable even to walk because of drainage and cauvery water pipeline digging. The contractors are not completing the work in one are, they just dig in one line and the other line is left and when asked they say that it is not mentioned in their plan. Further I have to state that there is a lot of scarcity of water in our are, i request you kindly look into the matter with top priority and also if the water connection where the borewell has been dug can be given connection. When ever the waterman or the engineer is contacted for the connection, they say one or the other problem and escape, even after six months the situation of the borewell which was dug in aswathnager is not given connection. text: 8/29/[PHONE] 12:13 187 Garbage collectors Hi team, This has become a monthly issue, the Bommanahalli ward cleaners come every alternate day clean the roads and, half way thru the road they collect the garbage in the bags and towards the dead end they dump it on the sideways creating issues for us residents. Until now we kept quiet on humanitarian grounds, considering the amount of their work and the whole coronavirus situation. But even after multiple requests, the cleaners or the garbage collectors do not pick the trash and outright deny us saying we cannot collect it or someone else in the auto will come and collect it. The cleaners are the ones who create the mess and it is us residents who have clean that mess. I have already made a complaint before on the same issue. Please look into it and get the place cleaned. We try our best to keep the area clean and if the workers come and mess the place it isn't out fault. 155 10.0 10, 2Nd Cross Rd, Phase 7, J. P. Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka [PHONE], India SSVD FOREST VIEW APARTMENTS 12.[PHONE] 77.[PHONE] Puttenahalli 6.0 Garbage and Unsanitary Practices Clearance Of Garbage Dump Or Black Spot BBMP Open 2

English translation: Hello, I am writing this email in connection with the development of the BDA area of Bangalore-[PHONE], in front of Banashankari 6th Stage, 11th Cross, Municipal Road, Kanakapura Road, Shobha Forest View Apartments. I have been living with my family at the address mentioned above for 11 years. Unfortunately, the drainage system and roads have not yet been developed. It feels like we are living in the British era. It is assigned to us as a BDA site. We have been contacting authorities for 11 years. There are only false hopes. When officials are asked by the BDA, they blame the BBMP for lack of sewage and road development. Lack of proper drainage systems, many mosquitoes, can cause health problems. We have senior citizens living here. It is unfortunate that this is still lacking in these areas of Bengaluru by [PHONE] with respect to the 'Clean Bharat Mission' launched by our Honorable Prime Minister Modiji. The so-called politicians just used the mantra to get votes and nothing else. I recently sent emails to [EMAIL] , [EMAIL] , [EMAIL] but no reply . Do they have these emails but not for responding to the problems of the general public? I attached photos of roads and drainage in our area. Please request that you check the photos and bring it in and help us get the right roads and drainage system rights pending for more than 11 years. Thanks in advance. There is hope to see change! text: 6-5-[PHONE] 12:16 56 Storm water drain bridge is broken The bridge built on a storm water drain is almost 18 years old, All the Chambers and parts of the bridges are broken or have big cracks. This is a grave danger for everyone, tractors and huge vehicles are constantly moving on this bridge, weakening the structure with heavy rains and covered drain holes Making it worse. This morning, a tractor's rear end went into one of the chamber, breaking the chamber and weakening the structure. It's been open and the road has been blocked since then. It smells so bad, and we realized that the drain is filled with garbage and mud and that's the reason the water flows on the bridge during heavy rainfall. The residents of our area, would want the government to take necessary action as this is the only road for more than 20 houses, if it collapses, we will have no other way to even get out of our houses. cleaned_text: 6-5-[PHONE] 12:16 56 Storm water drain bridge is broken The bridge built on a storm water drain is almost 18 years old, All the Chambers and parts of the bridges are broken or have big cracks. This is a grave danger for everyone, tractors and huge vehicles are constantly moving on this bridge, weakening the structure with heavy rains and covered drain holes Making it worse. text: 7/22/[PHONE] 11:27 9 Borewell water usage for car wash in car wash centers. Waste of water. Stop car wash centers in bangalore Hi Team, Bangalore is heading towards very serious problem of water. In our area (vidyaranyapura) there are many car wash centers which are using borewell water to wash cars, specially the car wash center behind Indian Oil petrol pump near kodigehalli railway station. We are observing this car wash center is using two to three tanker everyday to wash cars. If such car wash continue to use water for thier bussiness, we wont be left with water to use for our daily use in coming days. We request BBMP to take strong action agaist such car wash centers. specially the center behind indian oil petrol pump. Please take some action against them. Yours responsible bangalorian, Sumaya Behera [PHONE] 182 2.0 Thindlu Main Rd, Virupakshapura, Bengaluru, Karnataka [PHONE], India Behind indian oil petrol pump 13.[PHONE] 77.[PHONE] Vidyaranyapura 23.0 Water Supply and Services Regular Water Supply BWSSB Open 0

text: 10-12-[PHONE] 22:49 5 Belahalli turned into dumpyard of Bangalore Residents in Brigade... Belahalli turned into dumpyard of Bangalore Residents in Brigade NorthRidge, situated very close to Belahalli cross, are having horrid time because of the obnoxious smell coming from dumpyard. The situation has worsened drastically since few weeks. People are being forced to stay indoors with doors and windows closed. The obnoxious gas coming from dumpyard poses serious health hazards. Since mixed waste is getting dumped, there is a huge chance of toxins spreading into the underlying water tables which can have even serious consequences as most of Bangalore is dependent on ground water. The current need of the hour is to stop this obnoxious smell which is making life horrible for citizens. The smell is specially non tolerable near Belahalli cross, near upcoming Shobha project Dream Gardenia. 155 10.0 Unnamed Road, Agrahara Badavane, Bengaluru, Karnataka [PHONE], India 13.[PHONE] 77.[PHONE] Jakkuru 6.0 Garbage and Unsanitary Practices Clearance Of Garbage Dump Or Black Spot BBMP On-the-Job 3

text: 7/31/[PHONE] 13:34 191 Letter to BBMP Commissioner for requesting for Street Lights Sub:- Request for Street light : How hazardous it is to not have streetlights in my area as it can cause a lot of illegal activities, like prostitution, Drug, Ganja and robberies making it a safety issue of the citizens. With all due respect, Sir, it is stated that I live In the far end building of the society. I have been requesting for streetlights to the building owner since some time now but he doesnt seem to pay attention. text: 8-3-[PHONE] 11:39 173 Noise Pollution We have knocked on the doors of local police and also politicians but till date we have not received any positive outcome for our expressed concerns. Hope at least there shall be some action taken here. We are residents of 3rd A Cross, New Venkatapura, Koramangala 1st Block, Bangalore-[PHONE]. #309/1, Ground and 1st floor Building. This building is located in a residential place and we are the neighbours of that building. The owner of the building has rented out one of the shops to an Metal Industrial Work. Every single day we are facing lots and lots of noise pollution because of this shop from the last 6-8 months. Despite highlighting this to the local authorities nobody is bothered to take any action. isn't there a demarcation of Residential and Industrial places Sir? How are we supposed to stay at home with the loud noise of metal cutting and hammering every single day. This starts every day from morning 10:00 AM to 6:00 PM. Loud noise of Metal cutting, Metal Hammering, Welding Gas Pollution. We are not able to sit at home, our kids are not able to study, and old people are suffering every single day because of this noise & welding Gas pollution. Despite us staying in a residential area, we feel as if we are now staying in some Industrial area. with a lot of hopes we are posting our complaint here, we hope our complaint will not go unnoticed as it has gone with Police and other authorities. Building owner's name is Gangadhar and his mobile number is +91 [PHONE] [PHONE]. The last time the authorities have closed the complaint saying it is resolved. I don't know what you have done, as i see the situation has become worse now. I am a resident of 9th cross, abahiahreddy layout, Kaggadaspura. Many of the vacant plots here are occupied by daily wage workers who are staying here in temporarily constructed huts. They have created a manance here on the roads and near by areas by defecating in the open, washing, throwing up garbage here and there. The whole area is now having a fowl smell and we are not even able to keep the house doors and windows open due to this. All kinds of flies and rats are now found here. We the residents have warned them many a times not to do such things and to just leave the place and go. But, as most of them are from te ill literate community,they fail to take our words and they seldom bother what we say. Kindly take this complaint seriously and take an action on this issue. I am not a permanent resident of this area, but i am concerned about this beautiful lake facing locality and the people staying here. text: 2/25/[PHONE] 15:40 150 Very bad condition of roads This complaint is regards to the AET junction ( connects rmz ecoworld, kaadubeesanahalli, Doddakanahalli and aet college). The road is so much jam packed nowadays (thanks to the shortcut to the office) that it takes nearly 1 hour to cross the junction (it's a 1km drive). The road is pretty small to allow so many vehicals at one stretch . Being a resident it is really difficult to take the road. And also to add a point on the conditions of the road - it is pathetic every twice in a week someone out of nowhere comes and digs the road and goes back by putting back the sand and jelly stones which is making the traffic even more worse. The roads has only pathholes which leads to accidents and not safe. Please do consider this complaint and try to 1. Broaden the road 2. Not to allow heavy vehicals (trucks) 3. And please lay tar (atleast 6inch) and make the zebra crossing marks for the safety. I believe the complaint would be resolved ASAP. text: 5/15/[PHONE] 15:22 188 *Water hyacinth in Madiwala lake*. As you are well aware that it'... *Water hyacinth in Madiwala lake*. As you are well aware that it's an invasive species growing rapidly and covering up the entire lake.When not controlled, water hyacinth will cover lakes and ponds entirely; this dramatically affects water flow and blocks sunlight from reaching native aquatic plants which often die. The decay processes depletes dissolved oxygen in the water, often killing fish (or turtles). The plants also create a prime habitat for mosquitos,the classic vectors of disease, and a species of snail known to host a parasitic flatworm which causes schistosomiasis (snail fever).Please take appropriate measures before it destroys the aquatic ecosystem. We the residents of area near the lake request you to take prompt and quick action to resolve the matter before it poses any threat to the residents near the lake!!!This lake is just not for beautification but life. Thanks in advance Bangaloreans and madiwala lake well 155 10.0 Blue Malibu - Nr & Aarna Projects, Virat Nagar, Bommanahalli, Bengaluru, Karnataka, India 12.[PHONE] 77.[PHONE] Bilekahalli 6.0 Garbage and Unsanitary Practices Clearance Of Garbage Dump Or Black Spot BBMP Open 0

text: 4/20/[PHONE] 15:10 111 Public urination in footpath opposite to Brigade road BMTC Bus Stand BMTC bus drivers and others have converted a portion of the footpath opposite to BMTC bus stand as a public toilet to urinate. The footpath overflows with urine everytime creating foul smell .It has become a breeding ground for mosquitoes and flies. The footpath area is right next to the junction connecting Brigade and Margrath road. There was public bio toilets in the exact same location two years back. But the same has been removed now and people are using open space to urinate. Thousands of people cross the footpath everyday including children and senior citizens. This corner of the footpath has become a disease generating center. I request the authorities to kindly take action and to build public toilets in the vicinity. I request the BBMP 709 10.0 Brigade Rd, Shanthala Nagar, Ashok Nagar, Bengaluru, Karnataka [PHONE], India Opposite to Sapper War Memorial 12.[PHONE] 77.[PHONE] Shantala Nagar 708.0 Yellow Spot 1A- Address Public Urination or Yellow Spots BBMP Open 0

text: 9/24/[PHONE] 21:27 82 Bad condition of footpaths Hello sir/madam, Bangalore is a metropolitan city where so many people from different parts of India come to live here and work here. We work in companies in Bangalore for the welfare of the city. Everyone knows that bangalore is a city of great MNCs. So it's obvious that people want to come here to work. People work in bangalore which will benefit both government and to their self. Bangalore is a costly city, the cost of living here is so much compared to other cities but still people come to this city to make their livelihood. It's your responsibility to provide at least basic facilities to the people who came here far away from their house. And the basic thing is good condition of roads. As there are so many companies in bangalore, there will be so many people around the office at a distance of 2-3 km. They may prefer to come by bus or by foot. Even if they take a bmtc bus, they still wants to walk a certain distance to reach a bus stop. But here the footpaths are in such a bad condition that it looks like a mud path rather than a footpath. Even with a light drizzle, the footpath becomes so dirty that people have to walk on the bricks side to the footpath. Then what is the use of having footpath if people are walking on the bricks? I am working in a company in ITPL, whitefield. There is a footpath between brigade bhuwalka icon to international tech park and from international tech park to the den hotel. The path in between itpl and den is so bad. It's in the worst condition. That path is full of mud and there are no cement bricks on it. And whenever rain happens it will become a mini pond. There will be hundreds of people walking in that path everyday. As bangalore state government, it's your responsibility to take care of these footpaths. If you are not able to make a full path of cement bricks, atleast make a row of those so that people can walk on it in a line. Please I request you to take care of these paths. Because of that mud, we are suffering so much. I again request you to please take care of these roads. I am not asking you to give us money or jewellery, nor we are asking to decrease our cost of living here. We are just asking you to give us proper roads because from morning till night, roads play a major role in our lives. Those are the main source which take us from one part to another part. I really hope you take action on it as soon as possible because it is really needed. 56 10.0 Unnamed Road, Kiadb Export Promotion Industrial Area, Whitefield, Bengaluru, Karnataka [PHONE], India International tech park 12.[PHONE] 77.[PHONE] Garudachar Palya 15.0 Mobility - Roads, Footpaths and Infrastructure Flooding/Waterlogging Of Roads And Footpaths BBMP On-the-Job 1
